ONE.graphic_title: Border Patrol month over month apprehension rate, 2000-2013
ONE.prose: This chart shows the rate of increase or decrease in border patrol apprehensions from month to month for each fiscal year from 2000 to 2013. Each line represents one year of data with the first month used as a benchmark. The bold line is the average of all 13.
ONE.note: Lighter lines represent a single year. The bold line is an average of all 13.

TWO.graphic_title: Border Patrol month over month apprehension rate, 2014-2017
TWO.prose: This chart shows the rate of increase or decrease in border patrol apprehensions from month to month for 2014-2017.

THREE.graphic_title: Border Patrol month over month apprehension rate, 2000-2017
THREE.prose: This chart shows the rate of increase or decrease in border patrol apprehensions from month to month for 2000-2017.

FOUR.graphic_title: Border Patrol apprehensions of Mexicans vs non-Mexicans
FOUR.prose: This chart contrasts the number of Mexicans apprehended at the U.S. southern border with the number of people from every other country of origin each year from 2000 to 2017
